slides.caption: Homepage
slides.byline1: By Alex Zhao and Yucheng Tang
slides.subtitle: We spent a year in Beijing, immersed in sounds and sights both strange and familiar.
slides.instruction: Click the arrows or hit your keyboard arrows to navigate the exhibit.

slides.caption: Sounds of Nature
slides.title: Sounds of Nature
slides.author: Christina Lai, Michelle Fang
slides.text: This year, we explored nature and urban life in tandem. From hutongs to Tsinghua's campus, we heard birds chirping. On the left, we hear birds in a hutong in Dongcheng. Below, we hear a bird song in front of Schwarzman College.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: Bird Song
slides.author: Arjun Sai, Eli Morimoto
slides.text: Click the left image to hear a Chinese blackbird perched within Tsinghua. The blackbird comes often after the arrival of spring. Below, we hear the sounds of birds and moped alarms mixed together near Houhai, Beijing.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: Exploring Beyond the City
slides.author: Serge-Raymond Nzabandora
slides.text: Most of us explored villages on the outskirts of Beijing also. Below, watch videos from Gubeikou Water Town and the Great Wall. The chaos of Beijing's urban center is surrounded by serene scenes of nature.

slides.caption: Robots Among Us
slides.title: Robotic Voices
slides.author: Gurchit Chatha, Pearl Xu
slides.text: Robots live among us in Beijing. On the left is a delivery robot commonly seen in hotels. Below is a robot making knife-cut noodles in a canteen on Tsinghua's campus.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: Robotic Voices
slides.author: Raven Witherspoon, Alex Zhao, Chen Xiao
slides.text: Robotic voices abound in Beijing. The left is the sound of Baidu maps, guiding a bicyclist. Below, hear the familiar sounds of a HelloBike unlocking and a kuaidi tricycle backing up.

one.title: Hidden Flutist
one.author: Hasani Arnold
one.text: On the left, we hear the sounds of a mystery musician, hidden in a guard booth, playing the flute.

two.title: Conducting Air
two.author: Gurchit Chatha
two.text: On the right, we see a symphony conductor practicing his art to a phantom orchestra.

one.title: Plaza Dancers
one.author: Gurchit Chatha
one.text: Beijing's public spaces are filled with music. Open plaza dancing is a typical scene. With just a speaker and an open space, countless Chinese 'aunts' will gather in the evening to dance.

two.title: Olympic Dancers
two.author: Lujain Ibrahim
two.text: On the right, volunteers at the Olympic games dance before the opening ceremony.

slides.caption: Park Life
slides.title: Park Life
slides.author: Gurchit Chatha, Alex Li
slides.text: In the midst of the cherry blossom bloom, two women practice their shuttlecock kicking (jianzi). They've both honed their skills for over a decade. In Jingshan, a group of elderly sing 'Daba Guilai,' a popular patriotic song in China. In Qingnian Park, a man plays with his diabolo - hear the traditional toy's buzzing as he spins it.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: Park Life
slides.author: Ben Ma, Jenn Hu
slides.text: Beijing's parks are full of life. In the Temple of Earth, a lady rapped to the clatter of kuaiban (bamboo clappers): 'Today's Beijing is more colorful, dazzling and sparkling, it lights up Beijing ren.' Below an accordionist plays 'Night on the outskirts of Moscow.' On the left, we recorded the clamor of children in Beihai.

one.title: Obedience
one.author: Christina Lai
one.text: On the left, students at Tsinghua complete their daily nucleic acid testing. Failing to test results in a red Zijing code. This pair of videos, though different, form the two sides of Chinese pride and obedience.

two.title: Respect
two.author: Lujain Ibrahim
two.text: On the right, tourists and a few locals pack into Tiananmen Square to watch the sunrise flag raising.

slides.caption: Hutongs and Streets
slides.title: Hutongs and Streets
slides.author: Karuna Nandkumar, Christina Lai
slides.text: The streets and hutong alleys of Beijing bustle with life. The sounds of bicycles overlap with the rush of delivery drivers. Shopkeepers play prerecorded promo slogans. In the hutongs, leisure, business, and residences collide.

one.title: Sanlitun Bar
one.author: Zhou Yu
one.text: Bars and nightclubs packed with people. For most of our year, nightlife in Beijing happened with the rhythm of the weekend; after lockdown, nights out seemed like a lifetime away.

two.title: Sanlitun Club
two.author: Raven Witherspoon
two.text: Dance to the roar of the crowd from a nighttime club in Sanlitun.

one.title: Nighttime Busker
one.author: Raven Witherspoon
one.text: The left is from a wandering singer on the streets of Beijing, and one is from a Schwarzman scholar.

two.title: KTV
two.author: Karuna Nandkumar
two.text: One is on a crowded street, and the other at KTV where everyone is singing.

one.title: Playhouse Rapper
one.author: Trevaughn Latimer
one.text: A tale of two songs. At Playhouse, a common haunt this year, a rapper struts the stage.

two.title: A Christmas Carol
two.author: Zhou Yu
two.text: At Christmas 2021, scholars sang carols together after the talent show.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: Concerts & Music
slides.author: Christina Lai, Jenn Hu, Karuna Nandkumar
slides.text: In Beijing, we found concerts of all kinds in many venues. We heard indie bands play in School and in school auditoriums.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: Concerts & Music
slides.author: Zhou Yu, Sally Xu
slides.text: Scholars joined in bands to sing and play together - though Ilene seems to forgotten to play her part on the flute here. Below, the school shuttle plays 'Little Dimple,' a classic Chinese love song.

one.title: Tsinghua Orchestra
one.author: Trevaughn Latimer
one.text: The Tsinghua symphony features talented musicians from all over China.

two.title: Xinjiang Music
two.author: Trevaughn Latimer
two.text: Musicians from Xinjiang visited the college and performed songs with just a frame drum and rawap.

slides.caption: Food
slides.title: Food
slides.author: Selena Guo, Trevaughn Latimer, Hasani Arnold
slides.text: In C-Lou, cook griddles a 'leng mian' wrap with a hiss. In the Guangdong window on Zijing first floor, a chef chops the barbecue pork with a cleaver. At hot pot, hungry patrons drop vegetables into a gurgling, boiling pot.

slides.caption: Sports
slides.title: Athletes Keeping the Rhythm
slides.author: Trevaughn Latimer, Vodka Fu
slides.text: Scholars won first place in tug-of-war this year as part of the schoolwide Ma Cup. The Schwarzman team kept the beat and quickly won the match. On the left, students practice rowing in unison for dragon boat.

one.title: One Shot, One Goal
one.author: Yucheng Tang
one.text: Watch Wan Fung Chui make a penalty in this heartstopper.

two.title: Soccer Huddle
two.author: Sally Xu
two.text: At halftime, the Schwarzman men's soccer team boosts their spirits with a huddle and a chant.

slides.caption: Lockdown
slides.title: Lockdown
slides.author: Sally Xu, Yucheng Tang, Pearl Xu
slides.text: In May, Tsinghua University entered lockdown. Our classmates sang on the campus fields, had picnics, and chatted under the stars. Later, we started to be unable to order takeout, and we needed to go to a centralized location to get packages. At last, the fences around the school were fortified with planks, blocking the outside world.

one.title: Farewell, Farewell
one.author: Sally Xu
one.text: Burdened by the lockdown, many scholars left Beijing early for their hometowns.

two.title: In Search of MRI
two.author: Michelle Fang
two.text: We said farewell to Wan Fung, who returned home for an MRI he couldn't get during lockdown.

slides.byline1: By Alex Zhao and Yucheng Tang
slides.subtitle: Thank you to all of our friends who made this project possible by sending in their memories.
slides.instruction: If you have an idea for a page or want to submit your own memories, reach out to either of us.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: Out on the Field
slides.author: Miranda Li
slides.text: On the left, Jiaheng He demonstrates how to march in the 'phalanx' parade for Tsinghua's Ma sports tournament. Below, scholars enjoy each other’s company on a pleasant summer evening during campus lockdown.

sound_captions: Schwarzman College's windows are also good windows for observing the four seasons. The bare branches sway gently in the wind, and the setting sun bathes them in gold. Nearby, a speaker plays the song 'Secret Love Amid Peach Blossoms'. Recorded by Yucheng Tang.

7港9 (Qigangjiu) is one of the most popular milk tea shops in Tsinghua. Whenever I grab my milk tea and turn to go, the shopkeeper calls out: 'Manzou! (Take care!)' Over time, this became a familiar sound in our lives. Recorded by Francesca Macchiavello.
At Schwarzman College, we are surrounded by a diversity of languages. This voice records how a Chinese-American speaks Mandarin. Recorded by Chen Xiao.
For all scholars who visited, the Summer Palace is unforgettable. Wind ripples the water, visitors climb Tibetan Buddhist temples, and mandarin ducks glide across the lake. Recorded by Jenn Hu.

When we collected voices, several students submitted their memories of Qigangjiu milk tea. There is no 'slow walk' in this segment, but it contains another memory point: 'Open, drink and pack?' Recorded by Chen Xiao.

This year, Universal Studios opened in Beijing. The Kung Fu Panda World is unique to Beijing: a bit of Chinese culture exported, then returned to Beijing through an immersive park featuring red lanterns, soup noodles, and 3D animations. Recorded by Suraj Bulchand.
Traffic jams caused by bicycles are nothing new in the mini-city of Tsinghua University. Recorded by Raven Witherspoon.
On the eve of the Spring Festival, many Beijingers shop for last minute items. Songs heralding the new year are often played 24/7. Recorded by Raven Witherspoon.

Lover's Slope is a landmark of Tsinghua University, with grassy slopes, towering trees, promenades and vines. During the Workers' Day Holiday, students sang, picnicked, and played cards in this park. Usually a time for students to plan trips, this year the holiday was spent locked down. Recorded by Chen Xiao.
This is Cafe Zarah in Gulou. During the day, it is a quiet place for reading and work. At night, it turns into a bar, and readers become distracted. Recorded by Karuna Nandkumar.
Our thesis defense this year was hybrid. During Arjun Sai's defense, a reviewer's Zoom encountered a technical problem, recorded a clip of Arjun, and played it on a loop nonstop. Recorded by Ilene E.
On the island on Tsinghua's west side, the rushing sound of the waterfall continues through the seasons. As if the water keeps flowing, time will keep flowing. Recorded by Lucia He.

slides.caption: 主页
slides.byline1: 策划与设计 ｜ 汤禹成 赵星宇
slides.subtitle: 我们在北京生活了一年, 沉浸在既陌生又熟悉的声音和场景里。
slides.instruction: 点击箭头或者按键盘箭头浏览展览。

slides.caption: 自然的声音
slides.title: 自然的声音
slides.author: Christina Lai, Michelle Fang
slides.text: 探索北京的旅程，就从清晨的鸟鸣声开始吧。我们看见绿叶，闻见花香，看到灰蒙蒙的天空下大树舒展开枝桠。但我们常常看不见那些声音的缔造者。不过，我们至少还有机会仔细聆听。

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: 鸟鸣声
slides.author: Arjun Sai, Eli Morimoto
slides.text: 点击左图，你会听到清华校园里乌鸫的啼鸣，它们也叫百舌鸟，总在立春后鸣叫不已。右下方的视频摄于后海，你需要在其中辨别清脆的鸟鸣声和电动车的报警声。在两段录音里，你都会听到「自然」和「人类生活」的混杂。

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: 京郊探险
slides.author: Serge-Raymond Nzabandora
slides.text: 北京不仅有钢筋水泥，车水马龙。周末，我们的同学也常去探索京郊的新奇与美好。北方的水镇，生命力旺盛的野长城，莽莽山脉，落日余晖，这些是在北京城内领略不到的风光。

slides.caption: 赛博世界
slides.title: 机器与人，替代？
slides.author: Gurchit Chatha, Pearl Xu
slides.text: 机器人已经渗透进我们的生活。在宾馆，机器人可以帮你送外卖到你的房间门口。在清华校园，机器人可以帮厨师完成一些机械的削面工作。

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: 机器与人，共生？
slides.author: Raven Witherspoon, Alex Zhao, Chen Xiao
slides.text: 机器声围绕在生活的每一刻。无论你在开车还是骑自行车，只要开了导航，语音指引会一直伴随耳畔；解锁共享单车时，单车会发出可爱的语音提示；电动三轮车倒车时也会反复叫唤：「倒车请注意」。在丰富多彩的中国生活中，眼睛要看的东西越来越多，耳朵则能帮助眼睛分担观察世界的压力。

one.title: 「看不见」的吹奏者
one.author: Hasani Arnold
one.text: 我们的同学邂逅了两位民间音乐家。一位音乐家来自清华，很神秘，没有露面，只是从一个简陋的岗亭里传来了他演奏乐器的声音。

two.title: 对「空」指挥
two.author: Gurchit Chatha
two.text: 另一位老人旁若无人地练习着交响乐指挥，情绪饱满，湖面、绿树和斜阳是他的观众。

one.title: 中国广场舞
one.author: Gurchit Chatha
one.text: 北京的公共空间里充满了音乐声。广场舞是最典型的场景，一台音响，一块空地，无数中国「大妈」就能舞动起来。尽管他们曾无数次被投诉「扰民」，但这些投诉丝毫没有减少她们跳舞的热情。

two.title: 舞动冬奥
two.author: Lujain Ibrahim
two.text: 冬日的街头，一群冬奥会志愿者正伴着音乐的节拍起舞。这次冬奥会共录用了18000多名志愿者。

slides.caption: 北京公园里
slides.title: 毽子，歌曲，空竹
slides.author: Gurchit Chatha, Alex Li
slides.text: 在樱花绽放的玉渊潭，两位大姐展示起她们练了十几年的踢毽子技巧。在景山，一群老年人正在合唱《打靶归来》，这是首在中国家喻户晓的歌曲。在青年湖公园，一位大叔正在玩「空竹」，这是一种中国的传统民间玩具，空竹一会儿穿梭腿间...「嗡唔嗡唔」.

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: 黄发垂髫
slides.author: Ben Ma, Jenn Hu
slides.text: 北京的公园总是生机勃勃。在地坛，一位正在打快板儿的老太太唱道：「今天的北京更多彩了，绚丽夺目、闪闪发光，它照亮了北京人。」另一个视频还是在地坛，一位老人在用手风琴演奏《莫斯科郊外的晚上》，一位老人在指挥着演奏，还有一些老人在歌唱。而在北海，我们记录下了孩子的欢笑声。

one.title: 服从
one.author: Christina Lai
one.text: 这一组声音叫做「服从与崇拜」。清华校园里，学生一度被要求每天做核酸，如果不遵守，等待你的可能是紫荆码变红，校园的正常生活受阻。另一则视频，是天安门看升旗的游人如织。

two.title: 崇拜
two.author: Lujain Ibrahim
two.text: 百年屈辱之后，中华人民共和国在那里宣布成立。那是中国民族自豪感的象征。

slides.caption: 北京街头
slides.title: 胡同与街头
slides.author: Karuna Nandkumar, Christina Lai
slides.text: 北京的街头丰富多彩。自行车在马路上骑过，叠加了外卖小哥疾驰而过的喇叭声。在马路上，你还能听到各种店铺叫卖的声音——店家们提前用广播录好固定的推广语。北京的特别之处还在于胡同，胡同里尽是生活，孩子的嬉闹，大人的训斥，拍皮球声，都被记录。

one.title: 三里屯酒吧
one.author: Zhou Yu
one.text: 疫情前的酒吧与夜店。在封控时期，这些曾习以为常的吵闹和喧嚣好像恍如隔世。

two.title: 三里屯酒吧
two.author: Raven Witherspoon
two.text: 右边是北京著名的酒吧。在夜晚，一群藏身于现实生活中的人可以在这里做自己。

one.title: 流浪歌手的吟唱
one.author: Raven Witherspoon
one.text: 动人的歌曲可以来自任何地方和任何人。一首来自北京街头的流浪歌手，来自人潮涌动的街畔，关于粗粝和坚硬的生活。

two.title: 北京KTV
two.author: Karuna Nandkumar
two.text: 另一首来自苏世民书院的学者，来自众人欢唱的KTV里，关于时间消磨不了的友情。

one.title: PH说唱歌手
one.author: Trevaughn Latimer
one.text: 北京Club里的一场说唱表演。近几年，随着说唱节目在网络流行，说唱文化逐渐走入中国公众视野，但同时也面对着自我表达与内容审查间的张力，不少歌词在电视节目中受到阉割。

two.title: 圣诞歌会
two.author: Zhou Yu
two.text: 2021年冬，北京的圣诞。所有同学一起唱圣诞歌，迎接这个在西方国家最重要的节日。在西方，圣诞节就像我们的春节，许多外国同学想家了。

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: 多彩音乐会
slides.author: Christina Lai, Jenn Hu, Karuna Nandkumar
slides.text: 在北京，你不会担忧时间无处打发，许多不同类型的音乐会在等着你。

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: 校园里的乐与爱
slides.author: Zhou Yu, Sally Xu
slides.text: 清华校车缓缓行驶，播放着情歌《小酒窝》。几乎每一个中国的90后，都会知道这首甜甜的、让人听了想谈恋爱的歌。左边的视频里，因为Ben和Ava的演唱过于甜，小笛（中）似乎忘记了自己要吹笛子。

one.title: 清华乐队
one.author: Trevaughn Latimer
one.text: 清华的校园生活丰富多彩，看到一场心仪的乐队表演不是难事。

two.title: 维吾尔族音乐
two.author: Trevaughn Latimer
two.text: 来自新疆的演奏者来到苏世民书院，为同学们弹奏了颇具民族风情的音乐。

slides.caption: 美食
slides.title: 食物前史
slides.author: Selena Guo, Trevaughn Latimer, Hasani Arnold
slides.text: 我们也记录下了一些食物出台前的声音。C楼天猫超市，店铺小哥做烤冷面的声音，煎锅上的“嘶嘶”声不绝于耳。紫荆食堂一楼的广东橱窗，师傅切叉烧的声音，闹哄哄，热腾腾。在一家海鲜市场，鱼铺老板杀鱼的声音，麻利而血腥。

slides.caption: 运动
slides.title: 运动的「节奏」
slides.author: Trevaughn Latimer, Vodka Fu
slides.text: 拔河的精髓在于节奏一致。同学们依靠喊着「one two three」来保持节奏，很快赢得了比赛的胜利。左侧，凉爽的夏夜里，清华龙舟队正在训练。铿锵有力的鼓声控制着队员们划桨的节奏，船桨荡开湖面，传来一阵阵清冽的水波声。

one.title: 点球大战
one.author: Yucheng Tang
one.text: 点球大战时，每一粒球都足够让人屏息以待。——“咚”，球进了。对于观众而言，等待球员踢出那一脚时有多紧张，看到进球后的欢呼与快乐也就多真切。

two.title: 中场休息
two.author: Sally Xu
two.text: 队伍比分暂时落后，中场休息结束时，足球队员与教练们互相给彼此打气。

slides.caption: 封锁
slides.title: 「关闭」的校园
slides.author: Sally Xu, Yucheng Tang, Pearl Xu
slides.text: 五月，因为北京疫情，学校进入了封控状态。最初只是不能出学校，同学们在操场上唱歌，野餐，在星空下聊天。后来，我们开始不能点外卖，拿快递需要到集中的地点，喷上消毒液后放上一分钟才能领取。再后来，学校四周的栏杆钉上了木板，我们看不见外面的世界。这三份文件记录了这些声音片段。

one.title: 「我想你们」
one.author: Sally Xu
one.text: 五月开始，很多同学提前离开学校，回到各自的家乡。视频最后，Haris用中文告诉大家：「我想念你们。」如果一旦出校，他就暂时无法回来。

two.title: 坐着离开
two.author: Michelle Fang
two.text: 我们的足球队长在比赛中负伤。校医院的核磁共振暂时关闭，艰难抉择后，他决定提前和大家告别。

slides.caption: 声音迷宫
slides.title: 声音迷宫
slides.author: various scholars
slides.text: 点击图像可以聆听声音，再次点击则暂停声音。

slides.caption: 声音迷宫
slides.title: 声音迷宫
slides.author: various scholars
slides.text: 点击图像可以聆听声音。再次点击则暂停声音。

slides.caption: 猜一猜
slides.title: 你能猜到这个声音的来源吗？
slides.author: Lujain Ibrahim
slides.text: 你是真的了解北京之声吗？ 点击图像以播放声音，然后选择你认为发出此声音的选项。

slides.caption: 猜一猜
slides.title: 你能猜到这个声音的来源吗？
slides.author: Trevaughn Latimer

slides.caption: nan
slides.title: 立足中国
slides.author: Miranda Li
slides.text: 在左边，何佳恒向同学们演示了如何在运动会开幕式的方阵中气势如虹地喊出口号。下方，是封校期间一个惬意的夏日夜晚，人们享受着彼此的陪伴。

sound_captions: 宿舍的窗子也是观察四季的窗口，窗外的那棵树从枝繁叶茂到渐次凋零，光秃秃的枝头在风中轻轻晃动，夕阳照得它们金灿灿的。刚好手机在播放《暗恋桃花源》的主题曲。音乐和景物相得益彰。-Yucheng Tang 录制。
七港九是清华最受欢迎的奶茶店之一。每当一杯奶茶入手，准备离开，奶茶店的小哥就会说一句：「慢走。」久而久之，这成为了我们生活中熟知的一句话。-Francesca Macchiavello 录制
在苏世民书院，语言的多样性体现在生活的每个细节。这段声音记录下一位美国华裔如何说普通话。-Chen Xiao录制。
颐和园的风啊，水啊，藏传佛教的寺庙，水里游弋的鸭子，夕阳照过的小径，都令人难忘。- Jenn Hu 录制。
当我们收集声音时，好几位同学都提交了关于七港九奶茶的记忆。这一段声音没有「慢走」，但包含了另一个记忆点：「打开喝打包？」-Chen Xiao 录制。
我们在北京的这一年，环球影城在北京开放。全世界众多的环球影城中，功夫熊猫园区是北京独有的部分。整个园区位于室内，颜色变幻的灯笼，古典的中式建筑，山水画般的风物……3D技术和精心的设计还原了一个梦幻的中国古典世界。- Suraj Bulchand 录制。
在清华大学这个迷你城市，自行车造成交通拥堵不是什么新鲜事。-Raven Witherspoon 录制。
春节前夕，很多中国人会到超市购物，备上年货。超市常常播放着充满年味的歌曲。一个疑问是：欢快的歌曲是否会增强人们的购买欲？-Raven Witherspoon 录制。
情人坡是清华的地标，碧绿的草坡，几棵参天大树，长廊与藤蔓。假如你在情人坡上演奏和歌唱，草地上野餐的人们便成了天然的观众。不过，假如运气不好，你也可能会遇上凶狠的大爷，演员和观众都会被他驱赶。-Chen Xiao 录制。
这是位于地安门的Zarah Cafe。白天，这里常常安静，人们在这读书和工作。到了夜晚，这里变成了酒吧，读书人会被分心。-Karuna Nandkumar 录制。
毕业论文答辩以线上线下混合的方式进行。Arjun Sai答辩过程中，一位评审的Zoom遇到了技术问题，录下了Arjun的一段语音，并在过程中循环播放。这个技术问题给严肃紧张的答辩现场增添了一些欢乐。-Ilene E 录制。
清华校园西边的小岛上，经久不绝的瀑布声。仿佛流水一直流，时间就会一直淌。-Lucia He 录制。
